title: I just had a game that started promisingly, then 5 pings later, the whole team goes AFK.
body:
I don't think the people from my last game were adults.
Mid was 0/1, jungle was 0/1, bot was 2/0, I was 1/1
Lucian gets 2 kills then before recalling, pushes the wave in to reset the waves and get some experience advantage at which point our jungle decides to start a fight, which our mid joined despite their jungler being 2/0 and obviously they start getting their asses handed to them. 
As God intended, they both die.
Dying 2 times in a row didn't set well with mid so he starts pinging question marks (btw, the most toxic and useless ping ever, never actually used for MIA) on Lucian, i don't know why but the support also starts joining in. Now, Lucian gets tilted and says "Ping me once more and I'm out", our mid spam pings 
"Lucian  - Alive" (btw also pretty much useless other than contributing salt)
He DCs.
"Oh well", our mid and sup stands at base and keeps using their skills on an ally, dc-d Lucian. After another death, the jungle goes afk.
And there we have it, in a span of 20 sec, a winnable game turns into a 1v5.

This is why I tell people: One ping is enough. There is never a reason to spam pings... if a person is too stupid to understand after 1 ping, they're too stupid to understand after 5, 10, or even 20

That doesn't justify what they did mind you... leaving/afking is a stupid way to get revenge.

I spam between 2 and 7 pings, sometimes to the point of me getting blocked from spamming ping when I'm pinging my laner is missing or when pinging danger to another laner (generally i ping the multiple times like creating a path from where i believe the enemy is coming)

If you're pinging multiple times for a specific purpose (like - he's here and going here) that's not 'spamming', to me. Just like if you do a missing ping on bot and a warning ping on mid, or a missing ping mid and a warning ping on drag... those are specific messages.

If you just do the same ping more than once because you don't think your allies are smart enough to understand one ping... then you're just annoying those around you and I'll ping-mute you.

the reason i "spam" them, is simply became me (and many others) will not notice just one ping.
for various reasons such as: playing without sounds, being tunnel visioned on farming/trading/preparing you all in, not paying attention at the game in that second, etc.

The main reasons why I don't notice pings is 1) and 2) reason.
So, i usually appreciate more than 1 missing ping for example as i will very likely miss just 1 or 2.

Also my warning pings are not like "missing mid" and "warning bot"
Its more like: warning bot, and then warning up the river and more warning up the river, and then warning on bot again, and then warning on bot again. And maybe 1-2 missing mid pings if i'm still not muted by the system.
Or 3-7 missing pings on mid if i don't know where the enemy mid went.


Now obviously, i don't spam missing over the dead bodies of my allies. But generally, i'm with the "spam that ping, use it more than once" side of conversation.
I, and others I know, ping-mute for that. So be cautious about it. To each their own in the end, but be aware of the potential consequences.

someone was downvoting you.

anyway ping muting for that is fine. Its my preferred way of doing things, you can just choose to play at your own peace via the mute button (which was a nice addition tbh)
Just a note for you, if you ping like just once or twice, people like me are going to miss it.
If you tell people they're being jerks, most of them are going to downvote you. I expected it 100%. That's just reality haha

I have found that spamming a trail of pings across the map conveys ideas to awful teammates with more effect than pinging once.

Ping MIA on mid? ADC dies to roam, cries.

Spam ping MIA/Danger down the entire river? ADC either runs into turret and dies for no clear reason, or retreats.
I have found that multiple pings leads to you getting ping-muted. How do I know this? I ping-mute anyone who spams pings more than twice in a match.
Cool, not everyone is a fragile reactionary.

It's not so much 'being fragile'... as it is recognizing that anyone who would do that is not worth paying attention to.

1) You're wasting effort. A single ping is very low-impact. Spamming it requires you to spend entire seconds paying attention to pinging in stead of the game. 

2) You're insulting your allies. You are making the statement that you feel your allies are too stupid, inattentive, or bad to pay attention unless you spam it.

I'd rather not receive notifications from someone who habitually insults their entire team AND wastes effort performing needless tasks. It's not behaviour I prefer to encourage. So I don't.

> 1) You're wasting effort. A single ping is very low-impact. Spamming it requires you to spend entire seconds paying attention to pinging in stead of the game. 

I cant imagine playing LoL without macros and a gaming mouse, someone not using either has far bigger issues than taking a quarter second to ping.

> 2) You're insulting your allies. You are making the statement that you feel your allies are too stupid, inattentive, or bad to pay attention unless you spam it.

Fraaaagility alert. If allies are insecure enough for that to even cross their minds, they already tilted themselves with their own worthless existence and are a complete lost cause.

> you insulting others

Nobody is insulted except you,  and have some weird idea that multiple pings imply you are a bad player. More information is always good. And because you are incredibly insecure, the possibility of someone implying you are a bad player makes you lose it completely.

> The fact that you THINK that means there's something SERIOUSLY wrong with you and I would strongly recommend you seek psychiatric help.

Someone disagreed with me, they must be insane! Lets flame them!

More pings DOESN'T GIVE MORE INFORMATION. It gives the same information 20 tyimes in a row. As I already said earlier, if you ACTUALLY provide additional information with more pings(ex. pinging bot then pingming mid to indicate that's where they're likely going), that's fine. That's good. But if you just ping the same thing 20 times, there's no more information provided by that.

It'd be like if we were on voice chat and in stead of saying 'Mid mia' you shouted MID MIA 30 times over'. It's not helpful. It's just wasting everyone's time and attention.

Just had this earlier today for the first time...

Could tell in champ select. Mid wanted Yasuo but he didn't get him because nobody on the team picked him for the swap. He picked Teemo and everyone else was freaking. 

I made a big mistake early ganking top and we both died. This led to top losing his mind immediately. Soon he spent more time typing about how bad I was rather than getting CS or focusing on the game. This Mordekaiser had 30 CS compared to Yasuo 106 when lane phase ended. Bot soon died on their own and I believe mid after. Everyone is spamming FF at 15 - especially the support and top. At 15, I voted NO and people freaked out even more. I suggested adc farm or top farm to catch up but the still pissed off Top from the 2 minute gank kept calling me names instead and wanting to spam and complain to the enemy team. Now they're AFKing at the fountain and I'm the only one playing. Game ends, finally. 

Easily the most miserable team I've ever had.
